additionalInfo.title: Key Differences & Common Features

comparison.detail: Bengal was supreme; Governor-General controlled Madras and Bombay through correspondence
Bengal: Zamindari (Permanent Settlement) | Madras & Parts of Bombay: Ryotwari | Parts of Bombay: Mahalwari
Bengal: Could legislate for whole India | Madras & Bombay: Limited to their territories
Each had separate armies initially; unified after 1857
Supreme Courts in all three presidencies; Bengal Supreme Court (1774), Madras (1800), Bombay (1823)

additionalInfo.examTip: Remember chronological order of formation: Madras (first, 1639) ‚Üí Bengal (1690, but became supreme 1773) ‚Üí Bombay (1668 acquired, 1687 presidency). Bengal was the most important as it housed the Governor-General and controlled other presidencies after Regulating Act 1773.
